intro: Epidendrum pterostele, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and dark green, velvety leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. It thrives in rocky or shaded environments and is often epiphytic, growing on trees or stones. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a popular choice for orchid enthusiasts and botanical gardens.
